title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Living Room Layout", ca. 1934
medium: Graphite and red color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at upper center: LIVING ROOM/STUDIO 46 WASHINGTON MEWS;  inscribed in graphite with materials, instructions throughout; inscribed in graphite in  stamp: 520-3; 1/2"=1'-0"; RAND; WEST.;/ 5/21/34 / 8/14/34 / 5/21/34 3 / 8/14/34 4; inscribed in red color pencil on verso: VOID
description: Plan, elevations, and schedule for living room. Two large, multi-pane windows on north wall that extend and meet above door at center of wall. Entrance to staircase in upper left corner. Fireplace at center of east wall with Bakelite surrounding lower portion of wall and slate behind fireplace; soapstone or black terrazzo hearth. Four wooden shelves above wooden closet to left of fireplace. Curved wall to right of fireplace with built-in wood shelves; cork tile on wall above shelves and reflector light behind shelves. Shelves extends to south wall, and connected to love seat facing fireplace. L-shaped bar behind and to right of love seat. Upholstered chair and circular side table with frosted reflector near south wall facing fireplace. Glass brick wall on south west portion of south wall, with curtain above. Door on south west portion of west wall; piano on west wall in front of staircase.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Living Room Layout", ca. 1934.
ca. 1934. Graphite and red color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-515.
